JPEG 2000: <ref name="ft_1">Photoshop requires an optional plug-in from the installation disc to support JPEG 2000.</ref>

PSD: <ref name="ft_2">To import and work with a multi-layered PSD file in Lightroom  the file must be saved in Photoshop with the Maximize PSD and PSB File Compatibility preference turned on.</ref>

TIFF: <ref name="ft_3">Corel Painter does not support TIFF with LZW compression.</ref>

column1: Deluxe Paint*<ref name="ft_4">Deluxe Paint (and almost every other paint package) for versions 3.0 and later of AmigaOS can load and save any file format for which a datatype is registered on the system.</ref>

HD Photo: <ref name="JPEG XR">Requires the JPEG XR plug-in</ref>

RAW imports: <ref name="ft_5">Many RAW images can be imported  but are reduced to 8 bits per color channel.</ref>
XCF: <ref name="ft_6">GraphicConverter requires macOS or later with installed Image Magick application of the Fink package or any other distribution in order to support XCF.</ref>

TIFF: <ref name="ft_8">Microsoft Office Picture Manager and Paint.NET only support TIFF for viewing and editing of the first page.</ref>

GIF: <ref name="MS Paint Transparency">MS Paint doesn't support transparency in GIF or PNG</ref>

PSD: <ref name="ft_9">PSD is supported only in openCanvas 4 Plus  not regular openCanvas 4.</ref>

HD Photo: <ref name="ft_10">Paint.NET 3.08 supports import/export of images in HD Photo lossy & lossless format via a file-type plug-in based on a Microsoft HD Photo specification; it expires on September 1  2007 or if the Paint.NET version is 3.20 or higher. The developers hope tentatively plan to implement full HD Photo support by version 3.20.</ref>
TIFF: <ref name="ft_11">The free plug-ins needed for JPEG 2000  PSD  and XCF support can be found on Paint.NET's website .</ref>

column1: Tux Paint<ref name="ft_12">For the BMP  JPEG and PNG formats  the user is sandboxed in an interface that does not permit file system interaction  including viewing of filenames and the choice of a file's name  type  or location. Files are selected by thumbnails  and may only be loaded from one predetermined directory.</ref>
